review_content: The movie is so inept in terms of coherent, cohesive storytelling and in some other filmmaking aspects that it deserves to be laughed off the screen.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Basically a junior version of sci-fi disaster films ranging from The War of the Worlds (1953) to last year's The Mist
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The suicides are mostly very originally staged and creepy as hell...Mark Wahlberg is OK, but a scene where he 'forgives' his wife's indiscretion is just plain weird, as is Zooey Deschanel throughout.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan is far better at setup than payoff, and the Sixth Sense director's latest once and for all cements that reputation.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: a cold pastiche, neither bloody enough to attract the crowd that hankers for that sort of thing, nor smart enough to attract the crowd that hankers for that
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Happening promises a change of pace, but the magic only lasts for a few moments, then it's all open acre isolation, media blackouts, and mysterious threats with extended, mouth-agape pauses.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: There are scattered moments of craft throughout, but the gulf between his lofty aspirations and feeble accomplishments has seldom been wider or more chuckle-inducing.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan's still trying to take the story seriously-this is, horror of horrors, a message film-but his atypically unmeasured direction is all shock and no awe.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Were the first 45 minutes of The Happening not as rattlingly effective as they are, one could chalk the film up as mediocre. There is such untapped potential, though, that the dishonest places Shyamalan chooses to take his audience are maddening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: You know those meringue cookies that look so tempting on bakery shelves, the ones that evaporate moments after you pop them in your mouth and leave only the vaguest, unmemorable taste behind? That's The Happening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The Happening stutter-steps its way in this direction and that to a disappointing ending.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Portraying moments of drama and danger with a Hitchcockian lack of ceremony, Shyamalan's mundane depictions of tragedy create a quiet but weighty resonance.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: For all his complaints recently about being misunderstood, it seems it's Shyamalan who simply doesn't get us.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: This would all seem like a deliberate, self-parodying joke if it weren't coming from a filmmaker with no sense of humor whatsoever.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: As for The Happening, his throwback horror flick that plays like The Birds meets The Blob, it's beyond good and evil. It's dumbfounding.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: There seem to be a lot of people gunning for Philadelphia's own M. Night Shyamalan, and The Happening will give them more ammo.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The Happening wants to scare us without providing a cause -- a trick only Hitchcock has managed.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Instead of shocks, we get moments of tension, suspense and violence between stretches of running scared. Nothing wrong with that, except that the stretches are awfully long in places. And in the end, it all comes to not much.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Excluding moments of chilling effectiveness, this could fairly be called his worst film. Even his saving grace of keen directorial acumen visibly loses cohesion on screen.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Writer-director M. Night Shyamalan's eco-thriller starts with a clever premise and degenerates into spooky atmospherics, portentous pacing and stiff dialogue.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Somewhere in The Happening there's a great movie struggling to break free. The concept is fantastic... but poor dialogue combined with even worse performances make for a disappointing and frustrating 90 minutes of film.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: mia ap' tis pio akompses, proheires kai hontrokommenes doyleies poy mporeis na petyheis se aithoysa
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's a shame that the movie is such a tonal failure, because it does many other things right.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: I'm always amused by the sort of backlashes that Shyamalan is in right now. Well, M. Night Shyamalan makes vague, subtle fantasy thrillers. If you've outgrown it, don't blame him.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: If you're in the mood for an absurd film that alternates between boring and comedy, this is the movie for you.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: M. Night Shyamalan's worst film.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's an interesting premise for a doomsday thriller, but Shyamalan botches it from the get-go.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Trying to understand the thought process of writer and director M. Night Shyamalan is akin to analyzing Jell-O. What keeps it wiggling and what binds it together? This particular circumstance also had an Alfred Hitchcock vibe.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: just damned creepy
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Feeble gust of an environmental horror story.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Woeful clunker of a paranoid thriller.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: A patchy, uninspired eco-thriller whose R rating (a first for Shyamalan) looks more like a B.O. hindrance than an artistic boon.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan tries to give the events a scientific underpinning. But his logic is spotty, so what are meant to be eerie moments are not convincing.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Both silly and preachy.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan seems to have lost his sense of the fine line between the disturbingly grotesque and the outright ridiculous. The film even seems to be a parody of the scientific method.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan movies demand that you surrender to his way of telling stories. If you're up for that, you should go.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The whole solemn concoction is preposterous and not always in a fun way -- even at 99 minutes' running time, the movie provides plenty of opportunities for watch-consultation in the dark.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The screenplay is a mess, filled with unfunny moments of intended humor and funny moments of unintended humor.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: In a Hollywood summer otherwise dominated by comic-book superheroes, blazing action spectacles, snickering teen sex comedies and computer-generated fantasy, M. Night Shyamalan's The Happening is something different -- and a pleasant surprise.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's an entertaining movie, which is half the game, but it's not scary, which it should be. Neither is it something to be taken seriously, though it's intended to be.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan's such an eager recycler, grinding out the same ideas and images again and again. The man who showed such promise less than a decade ago has been leaving a diminishing creative footprint ever since.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The story essentially stops moving midway through. All that's going to occur, in terms of building any true dramatic tension, already has happened by this point.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: We don't care. It doesn't matter if they live or die, if there's a happy ending, or some kind of twist. The Happening is a movie to walk out of, sleep through, or -- best of all -- not to bother with.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The plot is absurdly preachy and illogical, and the dialogue uneven, with stinging lines followed by stinkers.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Executed in bland and remote fashion, with little in the way of compelling suspense, mystery or directorial craft. Think of the worst Spielberg thriller or one of Hitchcock's dull late career works.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: If Shyamalan's ever going to do something different then he should have made something manic, dark and twisted. But that's not Happening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: There's a long tradition of receiving messages from burning bushes, but jiggling bushes are not to be trusted, and neither are filmmakers who ask us to shiver in their leafy midst.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Not a complete return to form (by far), but also not a failure. Let's be fair--this is the best film Shyamalan has put out in years.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: No one will watch any of Shyamalan's recent films twice. A movie that features Wahlberg suggesting everyone try to outrun the wind can barely be watched once.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The final explanation, which comes as no surprise, is more preposterous than profound. If you want to see a scary movie about humans wreaking havoc on their planet, watch An Inconvenient Truth instead.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Wahlberg turns in one of his worst performances ever, but then he's saddled with preposterous scenes (like one where he tries to placate a ficus) and such lame lines as "Could this really be happening?" Funny, I was wondering the same thing myself.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: A subtle, measured work, which means there will be many who find it dull and pointless.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's creepy, silly fun. And if it came from anyone else, it would be recognized as such. One thing is certain: The man hasn't lost his ability to entertain.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Basically it's a half-hour Twilight Zone episode blown up to feature length.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Nobody gets the time or the treatment to become a character you'd actually care about, which makes the general planet-in-peril theme of the movie kind of moot.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: No mere actor could possibly escape the toxic dialogue oozing from M. Night's pen -- that's merciless.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's downright stupid.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The shock value wears off quickly and writer-director Shyamalan strands us in a boring cautionary tale with an infantile eco-message about humanity needing to live in harmony with nature -- or else.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Mr. Shyamalan is plagued by a bad case of Robin Williams Syndrome, characterized by a desire to inspire and change the world through mediocre entertainment Ã¢" in this case, accompanied by ample and frequently creative bloodshed.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: If this was the movie to rescue the reputation of self-styled genius Shyamalan after the disaster of Lady in the Water, then it's back to the old drawing board.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan's approach is more effective than smash-and-grab plot-mongering. His use of the landscape is disturbingly effective. The performances by Wahlberg and Deschanel bring a quiet dignity to their characters.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: A comeback for the director, but not quite enough of one...an almost equal combination of genuine creepiness and absolute foolishness.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: ...bad in more than just an everyday, sure-does-suck kind of way.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The film becomes less comprehensible as it goes along, and the audience -- expecting a patented M. Night ending -- is left with no answers, explanation, or narrative closure.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's also a bit sneaky of Shyamalan to set us up for a paranoid 9/11 thriller and then go all Greenpeace on us. He's trying to be socially conscious but he doesn't have the reformist's temperament. He has the temperament of a self-infatuated messiah.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: You feel like you're not watching the end of the world but the end of a career.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan wants the rustling of wind through greenery to evoke the same shudders in The Happening that the gathering of birds did in Hitchcock's The Birds
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The greatest excuse yet to get that anti-M. Night petition started. The last thing we want is a future of Shyamalan films with the knowledge that we all could have done something sooner.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan crafts a somewhat chilling cautionary tale; it just might have been more chilling if he had been a little less cautious.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: M. Night Shyamalan has morphed from "the next Spielberg" to a punching bag for critics and audiences alike. The Happening reminds us why.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Shyamalan's latest film is the first in a long time that I can't defend.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: If what audiences are looking for is a thrill ride, or even a pervasive eeriness, The Happening's just not happening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The Happening features an effectively stylized physical environment: rarely have clouds drifting overhead and wind blowing through trees and a sunny day been filmed so ominously.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The Happening is a film of such shockingly appalling writing, dreadful acting and ham-fisted, ungainly execution that it plays better as a comedy than the thriller it was meant to be.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: An impressive thriller which acknowledges the mystery that lies behind the marvels and the terrors of the natural world.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Bad and weird.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Another disappointment from M, despite some disturbing violence and chilly moments.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The movie is a bummer, from beginning to end.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: A tantalising, sometimes frustrating parable about the menaces that human beings might face from unexpected quarters.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Maybe Shyamalan has been plugged into those other worlds for too long. Judging from what is on offer here, he needs to become more acquainted with the emotional language of this one.

review_content: While hardly his worst work, this film is so far off his high water mark that it begs the question of whether M. Night Shyamalan will ever truly return.

review_content: If you have seen the trailers online or on T.V., you can just save your money and wait for the rental on this one. All of the best moments are in the promos.

review_content: Another case of elegant filmmaking kneecapped by a thunderingly stupid concept.

review_content: Shyamalan's essentially made a sociopathic movie.

review_content: 'The Happening' may not be M. Night Shyamalan's best movie, but it's his most provocative one.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Lacks scares, wit, humor and acting, and Zooey Deschanel, alas, has lost her cuteness.

review_content: It's clear that a once creative director is now running out of fumes, trying extremely hard to find something that hasn't been done before. The result is laughable.

review_content: Where the hell is Act III?

review_content: While there are certainly ideas behind it, the film lacks the bloated self-importance that plagued the director's last two efforts. This time, Shyamalan seems content merely to entertain us, and that's enough.

review_content: The Happening suggests [Shyamalan's] (con) artist's touch is waning a bit.

review_content: On a brighter note, the Wayans brothers have new material to make Scary Movie 5.

review_content: A creepy cautionary eco-thriller than neither cautions nor thrills. Instead of being full of dread, it's just dreadful.

review_content: Shyamalan's direction always seems so serious that it's easy to imagine he may be screwing up when he draws laughs, but I'd lay down money that many of these were deliberate.

review_content: If Shyamalan wanted to commit career suicide he couldn't have chosen a more likely vehicle than this laugh inducing 'thriller.'

review_content: What's more annoying than when a mediocre movie constantly males allusions to much better pictures? I know, it's when you wait an hour and a half for a solution this pathetic.

review_content: Ouch. 'Lady in the Water' was a dud. And for its ghastliness, filmmaker M. Night Shyamalan took one to the chin. He got back up again, though, to make 'The Happening.'This one's gonna hurt.

review_content: Someday someone will stop bankrolling Shyamalan's dumb dreams and keep this kind of tripe from happening.

review_content: ... M. Night desperately needs to find that special someone whose opinion he'll listen to when they say,'No! BAD writer-producer-director! NOT a good idea!'

review_content: The film does manage to build some tension, since the survival of the group remains in question right up to the end.

review_content: 'The Happening' works in early spurts, but apparently Shyamalan ran out of ideas once he came up with his uniquely insidious killer.

review_content: Works as an effective and brutally horrifying antithesis to the usual explosive summer fare...

review_content: There's never an ounce of suspense, mystery, or surprise.

review_content: I did find myself caught up in Shyamalan's apocalyptic world for a time -- before some really bad dialogue or acting would shake me out of it.

review_content: A monster movie desperately seeking a monster, M. Night Shyamalan's The Happening doesn't make sense, much less The Sixth Sense.

review_content: It's engrossing one minute and stupefying the next, off and on, off and on, for ninety minutes.

review_content: For Night, The Happening is a little blip on his career flatline. The guy just may pull through.

review_content: The true disaster on display in The Happening is Shyamalan's career hitting rock bottom.

review_content: It almost dares you to roll your eyes or laugh at certain scenes that are supposed to be deadly serious. But, you know what, I appreciated this creatively offbeat, daring sci-fi mind-trip.

review_content: 'There are forces at work beyond our understanding,' says Wahlberg. 'Especially beyond my understanding, if you include virtually every force at work.'

review_content: Maybe Shyamalan didn't mean for The Happening to be exciting and dramatic: perhaps the writer-director intended the film to be an exercise in sucking all the life and emotion out of fictional characters.

review_content: A numbing polemical morality tale in dreary doomsday thriller clothing, this dull downer for all its mass panic attack high alert mode, may be more effective in unintentionally boring people to death.

review_content: ...a minor, not quite successful film, but for M. Night Shyamalan - whose career has been circling the drain for some time now - it's a step back from the abyss.

review_content: Rather than [the R-rating]being an opportunity-opening device for writer/director Shyamalan to pull out of his toolbox, the graphic violence that got him that rating is more like a monkey wrench.

review_content: Nothing 'happening' here
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Other than its ripe possibility for mockery, I cannot think of anything that makes the film really worthwhile.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: When a movie's best bit arrives during the closing credits, we're all in trouble.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Only half good cinema, seemingly the result of its maker's stunted belief/determination in both himself and his audience.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: A better title for M. Night Shyamalan's The Happening would be Nonsense. It's like an amusement park ride that has no reason for being -- and no meaning -- besides visceral excitation. Only difference is that The Happening isn't fun.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The slight premise, coupled with some very bad performances by the cast as well as a screenplay filled with ham-fisted dialogue makes for a film that's not scary and borders on being ridiculous at times.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: For a movie with the potential for so much global-warming electricity, it's disappointingly low on voltage.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: What you end up with is a cross between Roland Emmerich's The Day After Tomorrow and Shyamalan's Signs.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Might be perceived by some as all peaches and cream for entertainment value even if everything else about it is not happening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: ...some nice creepy moments -- but other moments, and more, of (presumably) unintended humor.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: [N]owhere near the level of The Sixth Sense, and not quite as good as the subsequent Unbreakable, Signs, and The Village, but at least it suggests that the awfulness of Lady in the Water may have been an aberration.

review_content: Shyamalan's ideas might have more impact in a half-hour 'Twilight Zone' episode, where they would be shorn of some of the pretensions that seem to be mandatory in the feature-length work of a one-time Best Director Oscar nominee.

review_content: It's hard to believe that at one time Shyamalan was being touted as the next Steven Spielberg by Newsweek magazine, but if things keep going the way they are now, Uwe Boll might end up being a better comparison. And boy is that depressing.

review_content: Mark Wahlberg's sturdy performance saves The Happening from becoming a protracted Saturday Night Live spoof of M. Night Shyamalan movies.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: I'm shaking my head now like a caring teacher grading a poor assignment written by a bright student.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: There are some creepy moments but overall The Happening is a bit of a non-event.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Whether or not you'll like The Happening might very well depend on how much you like apocalyptic scenarios in your movies. I love 'em, myself. Show me an ad for a lurid doomsday flick and I want to be there opening day, right down front.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: This major studio release asks the question, how long can you survive on past glories? Shame on Shyamalan.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: Holy Mother of God...this is awful.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The Happening is an awful letdown, yet it leaves you with something new, as a gently waving tree -- that classical image of pastoral tranquillity -- mutates into a harbinger of doom.

review_content: Un nuevo fiasco de M. Night Shyamalan, que sigue siendo un director con ideas interesantes (tanto argumentales como visuales) pero que necesita urgentemente la ayuda de un buen guionista.

review_content: Usually Shyamalan can hide his limitations as a screenwriter behind his skill as a director. Here, that skill fails him as well, and the whole movie falls apart.

review_content: Shyamalan creates another urban myth with this slow burning thriller. But it never quite comes to life, due to stiff directing and acting

review_content: It is the first film of his career that feels incompetent and utterly gratuitous at times.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: M. Night Shyamalan offers up low-intensity thrills that fail to match the shivery shudders of his best work (THE SIXTH SENSE, SIGNS). His patented approach - mixing domestic drama with horror - plays out on a much larger canvas.

review_content: Shyamalan's religious ideas are a lot like Bush's: Nearly theology free.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: The M. Knight brilliance is there in quick jolts of suspense and terror, but those moments are the exception in this otherwise flat little thriller.

review_content: Shyamalan is a master at a visual iconic moment - but the "filler" (you might have learned about it in English class by this name: "story") gets weaker and weaker every film.

review_content: Shyamalan's latest is an improvement, but a full-fledged comeback ain't happening.
genres: Drama, Mystery & Suspense, Science Fiction & Fantasy

review_content: It's a great idea. A silent, unknown killing machine knocking people off while a science teacher tries to figure out why. But it just didn't work.

review_content: [A]n astonishment, so idiotic in conception and inept in execution that, after seeing it, one almost wonders whether it was real or imagined.
